headline: Ekiti election: Voters wait for voting to start in Ilawe
description: Voters are patiently waiting for the commencement of accreditation and voting in the governorship election in Ekiti State today.

headline: Ekiti election: Fayemi votes, hails INEC
description: The Ekiti State Governor Kayode Fayemi has cast his vote in the ongoing governorship election in the state.

headline: Ekiti election: Oni votes, alleges vote-buying
description: The governorship candidate of the Social Democratic Party, Segun Oni, has cast his vote at Ward 2, Unit 6 in Ifaki-Ekiti, his hometown.

headline: Ekiti election: 105-year-old voter set agenda for winner
description: A woman, who is said to be 105 years old, Felicia Fayomi, has cast her vote in the ongoing Ekiti State Governorship Election.

headline: Ekiti election: PDP’s Kolawole warns against manipulation after voting
description: Peoples Democratic Party candidate in Ekiti State governorship election, Bisi Kolawole, on Saturday, voted at his Ward 08, Unit 01.

headline: Ekiti election: ACP gov candidate denies withdrawal from contest
description: The candidate of the Action Congress Party in the Ekiti State governorship election, Mrs. Kemi Elebute-Halle, Saturday, denied stepping down from the race.

headline: Ekiti poll: SDP, ADC agents allege vote-buying in Iworoko, APC, PDP agents differ
description: Agents of the African Democratic Congress and the Social Democratic Party at Ward 2 Unit 8, Iworoko, Ifelofun/Irepodun Local Government Area of Ekiti State, have alleged that a particular political party was engaging in vote-buying at the ongoing Ekiti State governorship poll.

headline: Ekiti election: I will win, says APC’s Oyebanji
description: Candidate of the ruling All Progressives Congress, Biodun Oyebanji, has expressed optimism of becoming the next governor of Ekiti State.

headline: Ekiti election: Our people’ll defend their votes, says ex-dep gov, Eleka
description: The immediate past Deputy Governor of Ekiti State, Prof. Olusola Eleka, has commended the voting process in the ongoing governorship election in the state.

headline: We’re still discussing with Peter Obi, Labour Party – Kwanwaso’s NNPP
description: The New Nigeria Peoples Party has said, on Saturday, that discussions with Peter Obi and the Labour Party on a possible merger are still ongoing.

headline: Ekiti poll: Security of corps members excites NYSC
description: The Director-General of the National Youth Service Corps, Brig. Gen. Muhammad Fadah, has expressed delight at the adequate security provided for corps members working as Independent National Electoral Commission ad hoc staff across polling units in the 16 local government areas of Ekiti State.

headline: Ekiti decides: EFCC arrests suspected vote-buyers
description: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has arrested persons suspected to be engaged in vote-buying in the ongoing Ekiti State governorship poll.

headline: Ekiti election: Cleric sues for peace
description: As the people of Ekiti State go to the polls today to elect Governor Kayode Fayemi’s successor, the President of United Apostolic Church of Christ Worldwide , Dr James Owoyemi, has appealed for peace and the need to shun violence in any form.

headline: Ekiti decides: PDP gov candidate, Kolawole, casts vote
description: The candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party in the Ekiti State governorship election, Bisi Kolawole, has cast his vote at Unit 001, Ward 8 in Efon-Ekiti, Efon local government area of the state.

headline: Akpabio has been frustrating my life since 2009 – Ex-APC secretary, Akpanudoedehe
Ekiti poll: APC’s Oyebanji votes, hails large voter turnout
description: The All Progressives Congress governorship candidate in Ekiti State, Biodun Oyebanji, has lauded the large turnout of voters for the election.

headline: LIVE UPDATES: Ekiti governorship election results
Ekiti residents troop out for governorship election
description: As early as 6 am, residents of Ado Ekiti trooped out in their numbers to participate in today’s governorship election holding across the 16 Local Government Areas of Ekiti State.

headline: Mass turnout of voters greets Ekiti election
description: Unprecedented numbers of enthusiastic voters on Saturday thronged various polling units in different towns, villages and hamlets in Ekiti to perform their civic rights in the ongoing governorship election.

headline: Ekiti election: Confusion as NSCDC officers allegedly hijack party money
description: There was a mini rowdiness at Ward 10 Unit 9, Ilupeju along Ikere -Ado Expressway in Ikere Ekiti, in Ikere Local Government Area of Ekiti State as some officers of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps allegedly stormed the polling unit and took away a huge sum of money from some politicians in the unit.

headline: Ekiti election: Visually impaired voter request for help causes stir at polling unit
description: Request for help by an elderly, visually impaired electorate, who could not identify the logo of her preferred party led to a shouting march among agents of political parties participating in Saturday’s Ekiti governorship poll at Fajuyi House, Polling 007, Ado Ekiti.

headline: Ekiti election: APC deputy gov candidate wins ward
description: The Ekiti State All Progressives Congress deputy governorship candidate, Mrs Monisade Afuye, has won in her unit, Afin Atiba Ward 1, Unit 003, Ikere Ekiti.

headline: Ekiti election: PDP’s Bisi Kolawole wins polling unit
description: Candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party in the Saturday’s Ekiti State governorship election, Mr. Bisi Kolawole, won in Ward 8, Unit 1, Efon Alaye, in Efon Local Government Area, where, he earlier cast his vote.

headline: Ekiti: Many polling units inaccessible to people with disabilities, says group
description: The Campaign for Equal Voting Access for Persons with Disabilities has complained that a large number of polling units were not accessible by people with disabilities.

headline: JUST IN: Fayemi wins polling unit for APC
description: Ekiti State Governor Kayode Fayemi has won his polling unit, unit 09, Ogilolo ward in Isan-Ekiti, Oye Local Government Area for the All Progressive Congress candidate, Biodun Oyebanji.

headline: Full letter: How I knew Buhari had no preferred presidential aspirant, Tinubu writes
description: The presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress, Bola Tinubu, has commended the President, Major General Muhammadu Buhari (retd.), for leaving the party’s presidential ticket open for all aspirants.

headline: Talks with Kwankwaso’ll lead to Nigeria’s rebirth – Peter Obi’s aide
description: The Chairman of the Peter Obi Support Network, Marcel Ngogbehei, has said that the ongoing talks between the presidential candidates of Labour Party, Peter Obi, and his New Nigeria Peoples Party counterpart, Rabiu Kwankwaso, has a move to give Nigeria a rebirth.

headline: Abia APC factions reconcile, vow to win gov election
description: The two factions of the All Progressive Congress in Abia State have collapsed into one body ahead of the 2023 general election.

headline: I won PDP ticket before Aliero joined party, won’t step down –Saidu, Kebbi Central senatorial candidate
Ekiti: APC thugs beat me up, slapped my mum over vote-buying, voter alleges
description: A voter at Ward 01, Idofin, Odo-Ado, Ado-Ekiti, has alleged that suspected thugs serving the interests of the All Progressives Congress beat him up when he challenged them over vote-buying in his polling unit.

headline: Ekiti poll: Prosecute vote-buyers, SERAP urges INEC
description: The Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project has urged the Independent National Electoral Commission to prosecute politicians and those involved in vote-buying in the ongoing Ekiti State governorship election.

headline: Defection claim malicious – Lawan
description: The Senate President, Ahmed Lawan, has debunked news of his defection from the All Progressives Congress to the Peoples Democratic Party.

headline: Ekiti: SDP, ADP reject APC’s victory, to challenge result in court
description: The Ekiti State governorship candidate of the Social Democratic Party, Segun Oni, and his Action Democratic Party counterpart, Mrs Kemi Elebute-Halle, has rejected the results of the Saturday’s election, saying the outcome will be challenged at the tribunal.

headline: Niger PDP unveils first Christian gov running mate in 16 years
description: Aisha Wakaso, Minna

headline: People are tired of Lawan, let him go and rest –Machina, Yobe politician
APC, PDP members in Imo North collapse structures for Obi, LP
description: Members of the two majority parties in Nigeria, the Peoples Democratic Party and All Progressives Congress in Imo North Senatorial District of Imo State on Sunday collapsed their structures into the Labour Party and pledged their loyalty and support to its presidential candidate, Peter Obi.

headline: Ekiti election: Biodun Oyebanji’s full speech on electoral victory
description: Following his victory in the Ekiti State governorship election held on Saturday, June 18, 2022, the Governor-elect and flagbearer of the ruling All Progressives Congress, Biodun Oyebanji, has issued a statement on Sunday in respect of the just-concluded poll.

headline: Abia APC factions reconcile, vow to win state in 2023
description: The two factions of the All Progressive Congress in Abia State have collapsed into one body ahead of the 2023 general election.

headline: Ex-minister Orubebe resigns from PDP, gives reasons
description: A former Minister of Niger Delta, Godsday Orubebe, has resigned his membership of the Peoples Democratic Party.

headline: Peter Obi support group seeks improved voter registration infrastructure
description: The Coalition for Peter Obi has written the Independent National Electoral Commission, demanding an expansion of its voter registration and validation infrastructure to serve the teeming numbers of Nigerians willing to register.

headline: Why Nigeria’s next President must come from South -Ex-Minister Gbagi
description: A former Minister of State for Education, Chief Kenneth Gbagi, has clamoured that Nigeria’s next president should come from the southern part of the country in 2023.

headline: APGA women leader defects to Labour Party
description: The National Women Leader of the All Progressives Grand Alliance, Mrs. Ada-Orji Nwanyanwu, has defected to the Labour Party.

headline: APC monetised Ekiti gov election – Sowore
description: The presidential candidate of the African Action Congress, Omoyele Sowore, on Sunday, accused the ruling All Progressives Congress of monetising the just concluded governorship election in Ekiti State.

headline: Ekiti governor-elect’s landslide victory reflects popularity – Adamu
description: The National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress, Senator Abdullahi Adamu, has congratulated the governor-elect of Ekiti State, Biodun Oyebanji over his landslide victory at the poll on Saturday.

headline: Zamfara police resist bandits, injure one, recover AK 47
description: At least, one bandit was fatally injured and his AK 47 rifle was recovered in a gun battle between bandits and security agents in Gummi Local Government Area of Zamfara State.

headline: Anti-party activities: Kebbi PDP suspends senatorial aspirant
description: The People’s Democratic Party in Kebbi State has suspended a senatorial aspirant, Haruna Sa’idu-Dandi’o, for anti-party activities.

headline: Tinubu returns to Lagos, seeks massive LG votes, hoodlums attack convoy
description: The presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu, has expressed his appreciation for the support of Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu; his Deputy, Obafemi Hamzat; and the Oba of Lagos, Rilwan Akiolu.

headline: Terrorists kill three in Kaduna churches attacks, CAN, SOKAPU mourn
description: Suspected terrorists on motorcycles in the early hours of Sunday attacked two churches – the Maranatha Baptist Church and the St. Moses Catholic Church, all in Kajuru Local Government Area of Kaduna State,

headline: Ekiti: IGP lauds electorate, security operatives
description: The Inspector-General of Police, Usman Baba, has commended the electorate, policemen and other security operatives deployed to provide security during the governorship election in Ekiti State.

headline: Renegotiation of 2009 agreement at advanced stage, says ASUU
description: The Academic Staff Union of Universities has said the renegotiation of the 2009 agreement between the Federal Government and the union has reached an advanced stage.

headline: NSCDC, group seek criminalisation of vote-trading
description: A non-governmental organisation, Stop-Violence Against Women in Politics, has called for the amendment of the Electoral Act to criminalise vote selling the same way vote-buying is criminalised.

headline: JAMB registrar chides politicians buying N100m nomination forms
description: The Registrar, Joint Admission and Matriculation Board, Prof Is-haq Oloyede, has chided Nigerian politicians who he said preferred to spend as much as N100m to buy nomination forms of their political parties to equipping health institutions with such money.

headline: Okowa tenacious gentleman, says Atiku
description: The presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party, Atiku Abubakar, has described his running mate, Dr Ifeanyi Okowa, as a tenacious person regarding the party’s campaign to victory in the general election in 2023.

headline: CAN fumes as gunmen abduct over 22 clerics in one year
description: fewer than 22 clerics have been abducted by gunmen between June 2021 and June 2022 in Nigeria, investigation by

headline: NLC offers free medical services to Abuja community residents
description: Nigeria Labour Congress, in

headline: Why I danced before stepping down – APC’s female presidential aspirant
description: The only female presidential aspirant of the All Progressives Congress, Uju Kennedy-Ohaneye, ha explained why she danced at the party’s special convention and presidential primary.

headline: Russia-Ukraine war affects Bulgaria, Africa, world – Envoy
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine is having a negative effect on not only the Balkan states but also on Africa and the rest of the world as well, says the Bulgarian Ambassador to Nigeria, Mr. Yanko Yardonov.

headline: Imo police arrest woman suspected for child slavery
description: The Imo State Police Command has confirmed the arrest of a 26-year- old woman, Victoria Nwosu, for allegedly abusing and enslaving her three stepchildren.

headline: NCDC boss decries visa delay for Canada trip
description: This was following the concerns over visa delays by delegates to attend the 2022 International Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome  Conference.

headline: Taraba community gets first tarred road since 1942
PFN chair tasks Kaduna elders on youth mentoring
description: The Chairman of the Pentecostal Fellowship of Nigeria, Kaduna State Chapter, Apostle Emmanuel Bako, during the weekend, met with some elders in Kafanchan, to make proclamations that would change the tides in southern Kaduna.

headline: Corps member, five others feared dead in Bayelsa boat accident
description: No fewer than six persons including a female member of the National Youths Service Corps; a pregnant woman; a mother and her two children; and a 70-year-old man, have been feared dead in a passenger boat accident in Bayelsa State.

headline: Terrorists attack Kaduna churches, kill three, abduct many
description: Suspected terrorists on motorcycles in the early hours of Sunday, attacked two churches, the Maranatha Baptist Church and the St. Moses Catholic Church, both in Kajuru Local Government Area of Kaduna State.

headline: 15,000 Nasarawa youths, women drum support for Peter Obi
It feels good to be back home, Tinubu says as he arrives in Lagos
description: The presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress, Bola Tinubu, has arrived in Lagos following his victory at the primary election of the APC.

headline: Three-storey building collapses in Abia
description: Part of a three-storey building at Ahiaeke Ndume Ibeku in Umuahia North Local Government Area of Abia State, Saturday night, collapsed after a heavy rainfall.

headline: Imo prison escapee stabs pregnant woman to death
description: There was panic in Owerri, the Imo State capital on Sunday after an escapee of the Owerri jailbreak of April 5, 2021, Justice Anukam, reportedly stabbed a pregnant woman to death.

headline: Kaduna govt sacks NUT president, 2,356 other teachers
description: The Kaduna State Universal Basic Education Board says it has dismissed 2,357 teachers who failed the recently-conducted competency test.

headline: Owo attack: Ebonyi couple buried amid tears
description: Tears flowed as Mr. Chukwudi Onuoha and his wife, Mrs. Deborah Onuoha, who were victims of the June 5, 2022, terrorist attack in Owo, Ondo State, were buried in Ukawu, Onicha Local Government Area of Ebonyi State, on Sunday.

headline: Edo’ll benefit from $3.2bn US-Nigeria trade – Commissioner
description: Miami Trade Missionaries from District 2, Miami Florida, at the weekend, said Edo State would benefit from the $3.2bn worth of investment annually from the United States of America and Nigeria’s bilateral trade relations.

headline: Amazon set to steal Jumia, others’ market share
description: Amazon is set to steal some of the market share of major e-commerce players in Nigeria such as Jumia and Konga.

headline: Ekiti: Oyebanji’s victory must inspire us for more, says Tinubu
description: All Progressives Congress presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu, has congratulated Ekiti State Governor-elect, Abiodun Oyebanji, and the party for winning Saturday’s governorship election.

headline: Why I pushed on despite gang-up before presidential primary — Tinubu
description: The All Progressives Congress presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu, has disclosed that his victory at the party’s special convention and presidential primary did not come easy, noting that he fought a hard battle to clinch the ticket.

headline: Obi confirms talks with Kwankwaso’s camp, says it’s time to act
description: The Presidential Candidate of the Labour Party, Peter Obi, on Sunday in Abuja, said it is past time for prayers alone to salvage the country.

headline: ASUP faults Obaseki over academic unions ban
description: The Academic Staff Union of Polytechnics on Sunday vowed to challenge the ban placed on unions in Edo State Government-owned tertiary institutions.

headline: Lagos govt promises to boost food production
description: The Lagos State Government has restated its commitment to boost food production through the provision of quality farm implements for farmers in the state.

headline: Edo NULGE threatens showdown with LGs over salary deductions
description: The leadership of the Nigeria Union of Local Government Employees, Edo State chapter, has given the council administrators/management till the end of the month to pay arrears of check-up dues and other deductions from the workers’ salary.

headline: TETFund approves N15bn for national library
description: The Federal Government, through the Tertiary Education Trust Fund, has approved N15bn as first tranche for the construction of the 15-year-old abandoned national library in Abuja.

headline: Better times ahead, Sanwo-Olu assures citizens
description: The Lagos State Governor, Mr Babajide Sanwo-Olu, has assured residents of the state that better times are ahead as they support his government for another term in office.

headline: Lagos partners World Bank on solar power
description: The Lagos State Government has unveiled its plan to collaborate with the World Bank on the implementation of pathways for a one-gigawatt solar Photovoltaics electricity system in the state.

headline: NUT fumes as Kaduna sacks union boss, 2,356 others
description: The Kaduna State Chairman of the Nigeria Union of Teachers, Ibrahim Dalhatu, has described the competency test conducted by the state government as well as the sack of 2,357 teachers as illegal.

headline: Lagos, others record 36,482 tuberculosis cases in two years
description: A report from the Institute of Human Virology Nigeria, Tuberculosis Local Organisation Network 3, has revealed that no fewer than 36,482 cases of Tuberculosis have been detected in Oyo, Osun, Lagos, and Ogun states between April 2020 and March 2022.

headline: Kumuyi stands out among preachers, says presidential spokesman
description: The Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina, has described the General Superintendent of the Deeper Christian Life Ministry, Pastor William Kumuyi, as a preacher who stands out among the crowd.

headline: Mbaka’s followers protest, activist describes ban illegal
description: Followers of the Spiritual Director, Adoration Ministry Enugu Nigeria, Rev Fr Ejike Mbaka, on Sunday protested against the ban imposed on the ministry by Catholic Bishop of Enugu Diocese, Rev Callistus Onaga.

headline: Ekiti gov election: APC, PDP clash over vote-buying, Oni’s camp mulls legal action
description: The All Progressives Congress on Sunday took a swipe at the opposition Peoples Democratic Party over the result of Saturday’s governorship election in Ekiti State.

headline: Work against Okowa, Delta APC chieftain begs southern leaders
description: A Chieftain of All Progressives Congress in Delta State chapter, Prof. LeRoy Edozien, has called on South and Middle Belt Leaders Forum to work against Governor Ifeanyi Okowa and any other politician who accepted to be running mate to any presidential candidate.

headline: Tinubu’s homecoming: Lagos NUJ condemns attack on journalists, demands justice
description: The Nigeria Union of Journalists, Lagos State Council, has condemned in totality the reported attack on journalists by some hoodlums and criminal elements in the state on Sunday.

headline: Amnesty trains additional 450 ex-agitators
description: The Presidential Amnesty Programme says additional 450 ex-agitators have been deployed to facilities in the Niger Delta to learn the business of oil spill response, cleanup and remediation.

headline: Okotie begs Tinubu, Atiku to step down, wants to succeed Buhari
description: The Founder of Household of God Church, Reverend Chris Okotie, has asked the presidential candidates of the political parties for the 2023 election to step down for him in his bid to take over from the President, Major General Muhammadu Buhari (retd.).

headline: Again, bandits attack palace, kidnap Plateau monarch
description: Bandits numbering over 20, have again, reportedly kidnapped a traditional ruler in Plateau State, His Royal Highness, Aminu Derwan, after attacking his palace in Panyam, Mangu Local Government Area of the state.

headline: Passengers stranded as fuel scarcity hits Lagos
description: Many passengers were stranded at various bus stops in Lagos State, Monday morning, as commercial vehicles were scarce on the road.

headline: Kano Emir leaves for Morocco on official visit
description: The Emir of Kano, Alhaji Aminu Ado Bayero, has departed for the Kingdom of Morocco on a week-long official visit to the country.

headline: Nigeria ranks 143 in 2022 Global Peace Index
description: The 2022 Global Peace Index has ranked Nigeria 143 among 163 independent nations and territories, according to the level of peacefulness.

headline: Mbaka disowns followers over protest against Enugu bishop
description: The Spiritual Director of the Adoration Ministry, Enugu, Rev Fr Ejike Mbaka, has disassociated himself from the protests on Sunday against the ban imposed by the Enugu Diocesan Bishop, Most Rev Callistus Onaga.

headline: Labour in Cross River warns of impending strike
description: The Trade Union Congress, Cross River chapter, has warned of an impending industrial action in the state over issues bordering of workers welfare.

headline: Sanctioned Russia becomes China’s main source of oil
description: Customs data showed Monday that China ramped up crude oil imports from Russia in May, helping to offset Russia’s losses from western nations’ sanctions.

headline: Ganduje congratulates Ekiti governor-elect on victory
description: Governor Abdullahi Ganduje of Kano State has congratulated the candidate of the All Progressives Congress in the Ekiti State governorship election and the Governor-elect, Biodun Oyebanji, on his huge victory in the election held on Saturday.

headline: Group lauds Enugu people for ending political dictatorship
description: An organisation, Enugu West Patriotic League, has commended the people of Enugu West Senatorial District of Enugu State for joining hands with it to effectively end political dictatorship in the zone.

headline: Court remands 30-year-old man over alleged armed robbery in Ibadan
description: An Iyaganku Magistrates’ Court in Ibadan, Oyo State, on Monday, ordered the remand of one Rildwan Lawal, 30, who is facing a charge of armed robbery, at the Federal Correctional Centre, Ibadan.

headline: One year after arrest, lawyer seeks Nnamdi Kanu’s release
description: June 19, 2021 marked the beginning of the incarceration of the leader of the Indigenous Peoples of Biafra, Nnamdi Kanu, by the Federal Government.

headline: Japan court rules against same-sex marriage, lawyer disappointed
description: A Japanese court has, on Monday, ruled that the country’s failure to recognise same-sex marriage is constitutional. The ruling became a setback for activists after a landmark verdict, last year, found otherwise.

headline: We didn’t collapse our structure with any party – Abia APC
description: The secretary of a faction of the All Progressive Congress in Abia State, Perfect Okorie, has said his faction of the party in the state remains intact and has not collapsed structure with any other party.

headline: Lady who raised the alarm on Twitter apologises for faking kidnap
description: A lady, identified as Ameerah Sufyan, who raised the alarm about her alleged kidnap via

headline: Apapa port rail track ready in two weeks – Minister
description: The Minister of State for Transportation, Senator Gbemisola Saraki, Monday, assured Nigerians that the rail track that led to the Apapa Port Terminals would be completed in two weeks.

headline: How Colombia’s first black VP rose from maid to governance
description: There was jubilation in Colombia after the country elected Gustavo Petro as its first leftist president ever on Sunday.

headline: Train attack: Victims threatened by snakes, illness, negotiator says
description: The remaining 50 abducted passengers of the AK-9 Abuja-Kaduna train are being threatened by snake bites and sicknesses.

headline: No decision yet on voter registration extension – INEC
description: 11 days to the end of the continuous voter registration by the Independent National Electoral Commission, the commission has said it is yet to decide on the growing request for extension.

headline: APC Rep candidate, Eyiboh, criticises Akwa Ibom REC
description: The candidate of the All Progressives Congress for Eket Federal Constituency, Hon Eseme Eyiboh, has said that the Resident Electoral Commissioner for Akwa Ibom State, Mr Mike Igini, was on a voyage of self-destruction.

headline: Cash and Carry democracy: Saving primaries, elections from moneybags
12 days after winning APC ticket, Tinubu returns to Lagos
description: presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress, Bola Tinubu, will be visiting Lagos State today.

headline: Play national politics, APC chieftain tells South-East politicians
description: A chieftain of the All Progressives Congress, Hakeem Bamgbala, says politicians of South East extraction must learn to play inclusive politics if they hope to present an acceptable candidate for the presidency.

headline: NNPP merger with LP crucial, says Kwankwaso
description: presidential candidate of the New Nigeria Peoples Party, Rabiu Kwankwaso, on Saturday revealed that his party was negotiating a possible alliance with the Labour Party leadership and its candidate, Peter Obi.

headline: APC wins Ekiti gov election, thrashes SDP, PDP
authour: OLADIMEJI RAMON, TUNDE AJAJA, GODFREY GEORGE, ABIODUN NEJO, PETER DADA, FEMI MAKINDE and BOLA BAMIGBOLA
description: Supporters of the All Progressives Congress in Ekiti State erupted in jubilation in the early hours of today (Sunday) when the results of Saturday’s governorship election showed that the candidate of the party, Mr Biodun Oyebanji, trounced the 15 other candidates that partook in the exercise.

headline: Umahi can’t deliver Ebonyi to APC, says LP chair
description: Labour Party Chairman, in Ebonyi State, Splendour Eze, has said Governor David Umahi, who doubles as Chairman South-East Governors’ Forum, lacks the capacity and popularity to deliver the state’s votes let alone those of the entire South-East region, to the All Progressives Congress in 2023.

headline: UPDATED: INEC declares Oyebanji winner of Ekiti governorship election
description: The Independent National Electoral Commission has declared the candidate of the All Progressives Congress, Biodun Oyebanji, the winner of the Ekiti State governorship election.

headline: Serial contestants in Nigeria’s electoral system

description: An Abuja-based human rights lawyer, Pelumi Olajengbesi, has described the replacement of the name of All Progressive Congress Yobe North senatorial candidate, Bashir Machina, with that of the Senate President, Ahmed Lawan, as fraudulent and unconstitutional.

headline: Peter Obi’s movement bigger than EndSARS – Abure, LP chair
Ekiti election: Buhari congratulates Oyebanji, says victory affirms APC’s acceptance
description: The President, Major General Muhammadu Buhari (retd.), has congratulated the candidate of the All Progressives Congress, Biodun Oyebanji, over his electoral victory in Saturday’s Ekiti State governorship election.

headline: Osun PDP raises the alarm over alleged planned violence, election manipulation by APC
Colombia elects first leftist president, black deputy
description: Ex-guerrilla Gustavo Petro was elected the first-ever left-wing president of Colombia on Sunday, after beating millionaire businessman Rodolfo Hernandez in a tense and unpredictable runoff election.

headline: Court stops INEC from ending voter registration
description: The Federal High Court in Abuja has stopped the Independent National Electoral Commission from ending voter registration on June 30, 2022.

headline: Okotie seeks scrapping of National, State Assemblies to manage resources
description: The Founder of Household of God Church, Reverend Chris Okotie, has called for the scrapping of the National and State Assemblies due to the high cost of governance in the country.

headline: Kwara para-athletes threaten to shut down stadium over alleged N20m fraud
description: Kwara State athletes at the just-concluded National Paralympic Games in Abuja have accused the Kwara State Sports Commission of embezzling funds meant for them at the event, The PUNCH reports.

headline: UFC: Usman favourite over Edwards in rematch
description: Kamaru Usman has emerged as the heavy betting favourite over Leon Edwards ahead of their rematch at UFC 278, The PUNCH reports.

headline: Don’t rate Eagles with Sao Tome win, warns Fuludu
description: Nigerians have been heaping praises on the Super Eagles after the three-time African champions exceeded expectations with a stunning 10-0 mauling of Sao Tome and Principe in a 2023 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying match at the Grand Stade D’Agadir in Morocco on Monday.

headline: Simon thrilled to captain Eagles
description: is thrilled to wear the captain’s armband in Nigeria’s 2023 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying tie against the Falcons of Sao Tome and Principe.

headline: Udogie’s agent holds ‘pleasant’ meeting with Inter
NFF yet to pay me –Rohr
description: days after world football governing body FIFA ordered the Nigeria Football Federation to pay former Super Eagles coach Gernot Rohr $377,879.46 in compensation after ending his contract early, the NFF is yet to adhere to the directive, PUNCH Sports Extra reports.

headline: McCaw fears Aribo may face mental exhaustion
description: of the world’s foremost sports performance consultants, Allistair McCaw, has expressed concerns that Joe Aribo could face mental and physical exhaustion if he faces another rigorous campaign with such a heavy workload like last season, PUNCH Sports Extra reports.

headline: Eagles’ll be better against Guinea Bissau – Peseiro
description: , Jose Peseiro, say he remains focused on improving his team ahead of their 2023 Africa Cup of Nations qualifier against Guinea Bissau in September, PUNCH Sports Extra reports.

headline: Usyk bout: Joshua’ll lose unless I coach him, says Fury
description: Tyson Fury has suggested that Anthony Joshua’s new coach, Robert Garcia, will not help ‘AJ’ beat Oleksandr Usyk this summer, insisting he’s the best man to coach Joshua,

headline: Premier League releases 2022-23 season fixtures
